definition: to use (an animal or servant)/working (animal)/(beast) of burden/causative form of verbs (esp. in grammar of Japanese, Korean etc)
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
forced labor/corvée/obligatory task/military service/to use as servant/to enserf/servant (old)/war/campaign/battle

sentences.english: English and Chinese psych causative verbs fall into four broad categories.
sentences.chinese: 英汉使役心理动词按形态可分为四大类。

sentences.english: They work the horses too hard.
sentences.chinese: 他们过分地使役了这些马。

sentences.english: The causative verbs and their sentence patterns are one of the English basic characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 使役动词及其句型结构是英语的基本特色之一。

sentences.english: This paper explores the properties of causation, causativized verb and causative construction.
sentences.chinese: 使役动词及其句型结构是英语的基本特色之一。

sentences.english: In English, some nouns or adjectives can be converted to the causative verbs.
sentences.chinese: 英语中，部分名词或形容词可转化或派生为使役动词。

sentences.english: If the causative animal, it can not exceed the scope of their ability to withstand.
sentences.chinese: 如果使役动物，则不能超出它们能力的承受范围。

sentences.english: It is the most popular working sheepdog in the British Isles.
sentences.chinese: 为不列颠群岛最受欢迎的使役牧羊犬。

definition: to put to work (servant or animal)/to make use of for labor
to order (sb) about/(by extension) to put to use
ghost of sb devoured by a tiger who helps the tiger devour others
forced labor/corvée (labor required of a serf)/animal labor
variant of 仔豬|仔猪[zi3 zhu1]
